events.originalText: The first terrorist attack in Beijing's recent history took place when members of the Turkistan Islamic Party drove a vehicle into a crowd, killing five people and injuring thirty-eight others.
events.subtitle: Turkistan Islamic Party
events.headline: Terrorist attack in Beijing kills five and injures thirty-eight

events.originalText: In the Argentine general election, Cristina Fernández de Kirchner became the first woman to be elected president of Argentina.
events.subtitle: 2007 Argentine general election
events.headline: Cristina Fernández de Kirchner elected first female president of Argentina

events.originalText: A fire broke out on a Baku Metro train in Azerbaijan's capital, killing 289 people and injuring 270 others in the world's deadliest subway disaster.
events.subtitle: 1995 Baku Metro fire
events.headline: Deadliest subway disaster in Baku Metro fire, 289 killed

events.originalText: Prospero (flight spare pictured), the first British satellite launched on a British rocket, lifted off from Launch Area 5B in Woomera, South Australia.
events.subtitle: Prospero (spacecraft)
events.headline: First British satellite launched on British rocket from Woomera, South Australia

events.originalText: In St. Louis, Missouri, U.S., the 630-foot (190 m)-tall steel catenary Gateway Arch was completed.
events.subtitle: St. Louis
events.headline: 630-foot tall Gateway Arch completed in St. Louis, Missouri

events.originalText: World War II: Italy invaded Greece after Greek prime minister Ioannis Metaxas rejected Benito Mussolini's ultimatum demanding the cession of Greek territory.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Italy invades Greece after rejection of ultimatum

events.originalText: Indonesian composer Wage Rudolf Supratman introduced "Indonesia Raya", now the country's national anthem.
events.subtitle: Wage Rudolf Supratman
events.headline: Indonesia Raya introduced as national anthem by Wage Rudolf Supratman

events.originalText: The funerary mask of Tutankhamun , possibly originally made for Queen Neferneferuaten, was uncovered for the first time in approximately 3,250 years.
events.subtitle: Mask of Tutankhamun
events.headline: Funerary mask of Tutankhamun uncovered after 3,250 years

events.originalText: The U.S. Congress passed the Volstead Act over president Woodrow Wilson's veto, reinforcing Prohibition in the United States.
events.subtitle: United States Congress
events.headline: Volstead Act passed by U.S. Congress over Woodrow Wilson's veto

events.originalText: The Mino–Owari earthquake, the strongest known inland earthquake in Japan's history, caused widespread damage and 7,273 deaths.
events.subtitle: 1891 Mino–Owari earthquake
events.headline: Mino-Owari earthquake causes widespread damage and 7,273 deaths in Japan

events.originalText: In New York Harbor, U.S. president Grover Cleveland dedicated the Statue of Liberty (pictured), a gift from France commemorating the Declaration of Independence; New York City office workers responded by spontaneously holding the first ticker-tape parade.
events.subtitle: New York Harbor
events.headline: Statue of Liberty dedicated in New York Harbor by president Grover Cleveland

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: As George Washington's Continental Army retreated northward from New York City, the British Army captured the village of White Plains.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: British Army captures White Plains as Continental Army retreats

events.originalText: The Hōei earthquake ruptured all segments of the Nankai megathrust simultaneously – the only earthquake recorded to have done so.
events.subtitle: 1707 Hōei earthquake
events.headline: Hōei earthquake ruptures Nankai megathrust segments simultaneously

events.originalText: The Duke of York and Albany's Maritime Regiment of Foot, the forerunner to the Royal Marines, was established at the grounds of the Honourable Artillery Company in London.
events.subtitle: Duke of York
events.headline: Royal Marines established in London as Maritime Regiment of Foot

events.originalText: Ladislaus the Posthumous was crowned King of Bohemia, although George of Poděbrady remained in control of the government.
events.subtitle: Ladislaus the Posthumous
events.headline: Ladislaus the Posthumous crowned King of Bohemia

events.originalText: Civil wars of the Tetrarchy: Constantine the Great defeated Maxentius at the Battle of the Milvian Bridge in Rome.
events.subtitle: Civil wars of the Tetrarchy
events.headline: Constantine the Great defeats Maxentius at Battle of the Milvian Bridge
